By taking advantage of all structured and unstructured data — securing and protecting private information more effectively — Elastic’s complete, cloud-based solutions for search, security, and observability help organizations deliver on the promise of AI.
   

  

**What is The Role:**
 Elastic is searching for a Swedish Account Executive to acquire and expand our Enterprise customer base, including some of the largest customers. As an Account Executive, you will be focused on building new business and growing the Elastic footprint within new and existing ENTERPRISE customers whilst also ensuring that those customers are successfully leveraging Elastic across their organization. Are you ready to help users tackle their hardest security and observability problems through the power of search? If so, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing:**
* Building awareness and driving demand for Elastic solutions within the Swedish Enterprise sector
* Consultative Selling: Identify business challenges and create proposals for prospects and customers
* Uncovering new and diverse applications use cases to enable our users to work smarter, not harder
* Collaborating across Elastic business functions to ensure a seamless customer experience
* Create clear Goals, thorough qualification and accurate forecasting


**What You Will Bring:**
* A track-record of success in selling complex software based solutions into Swedish Enterprise accounts, demonstrated by overachievement of quota and strong customer references
* Know how the Swedish Enterprise Sector functions, what frameworks they follow and how RFPs are successfully concluded.
* A deep understanding and preferably experience selling into the ecosystem we live in, including Enterprise Search, Logging, SIEM, APM and Cloud
* The ability to build relationships and credibility with both Developers and Executives
* Problem solving skills that require a Holistic approach in order to understand the bigger picture
* Predictable, structured and accurate forecasting capabilities, Experienced SFDC and Clari user, not scared of the MEDDIC Qualification Framework.
* Excellent Time Management Skills and high level of Entrepreneurial spirit.
* An appreciation for the Open Source go-to-market model and the community of users who rely on our solutions every single day


 If you're eager to contribute to the world of Search Analytics and thrive in solving complex problems through the power of AI-driven search, Elastic wants to hear from you!
   

  

**Additional Information - We Take Care Of Our People**
 As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.
   

  

 We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.
   

  

* Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary
* Health coverage for you and your family in many locations
* Ability to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many roles
* Generous number of vacation days each year
* Increase your impact - We match up to $2000 (or local currency equivalent) for financial donations and service
* Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you love
* Embracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave


 Different people approach problems differently. We need that. Elastic is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation.
   

  

 We welcome individuals with disabilities and strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all individuals. To request an accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please email candidate\_accessibility@elastic.co We will reply to your request within 24 business hours of submission.
   

  

 Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws, view posters linked below: Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) Poster; Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision Poster; Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA) Poster and Know Your Rights (Poster)
   

  

 Elasticsearch develops and distributes encryption software and technology that is subject to U.S. export controls and licensing requirements for individuals who are located in or are nationals of the following sanctioned countries and regions: Belarus, Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Russia, Syria, the Crimea Region of Ukraine, the Donetsk People’s Republic (“DNR”), and the Luhansk People’s Republic (“LNR”). If you are located in or are a national of one of the listed countries or regions, an export license may be required as a condition of your employment in this role. Please note that national origin and/or nationality do not affect eligibility for employment with Elastic.
   

  

 Please see here for our Privacy Statement.

title: Cloud Engineer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
**Cloud Engineer | Stockholm | Modern Tech Consultancy** 




  





 My client, a fast growing Boutique consultancy, based in the heart of Stockholm to scale their business massively over the next year.
 



  





***What sets them apart?***




 This customer is an employee-driven-company they strive to make their business decisions around the betterment of their employees careers. This is why, very early on they decided to only pursue projects that utilise very modern tech stacks not only to capitalise on the ever-growing industry and it's innovations but also to ensure their employees are constantly working towards becoming the best Developers and versions of themselves that they can be.
 



  





**Desired Profile:** 



* Between 2-8 years of professional experience in Cloud Computing (AWS/Azure/GCP).
* Based in Stockholm or a commutable surrounding area.
* Any experience with skills like Terraform, Kubernetes, Kibana , (Azure) DevOps etc is advantageous.
* Fluent English & Swedish speaking.
 *Candidates with limited but progressively improving Swedish speaking capabilities will still be considered, should they be exceptional on all other fronts.*
* Any experience with leadership, mentorship or exp being a Scrum Master will be interesting and advantageous.



  





**What's on offer?:** 



* Extensive training opportunities in modern tech stacks and domains, including a monthly get-together for a day of knowledge sharing and upskilling (during working hours).
* Here you will find an environment of likeminded, passionate, peers and leaders, dedicated to the success and development of one another. Corporate workflows and environments are not prevalent. You will feel your value from Day 1.
* Paying up to 70 000 SEK / Month.
* Annual business trips.
* Consultants are deployed in teams so look forward to working with and upskilling with your colleagues whilst gaining valuable network connections on project.



  





 Sound of interest? Please apply with your up to date CV or email me at TMU@Thor-Companies.com

title: Security Operations Analyst
description:
**Company Description**
***Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!***
 At Sobi, the work we do every day redefines the standards of care and transform the lives of people living with rare diseases.
   

  

 As a diverse team of entrepreneurial people, we are passionate about our growth journey towards becoming a global leader, making a difference for rare disease patients, moving quickly and always challenging the status quo.
   

  

 We are committed to an inclusive, sustainable and flexible workplace that fosters growth and development.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Security Operations Specialist to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in cybersecurity and operations, with a passion for protecting and securing our organization's digital assets. Stay up-to-date with the latest cybersecurity trends and technologies to continuously improve the organization's security posture.
   

  

 Collaboration is key in our team, and you enjoy working closely with colleagues across different functions to ensure the highest level of security. At the same time, you are self-driven and capable of making independent decisions when needed. You have a natural curiosity for emerging cyber threats and continuously seek to expand your knowledge in IT security.
   

  

 This position is based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden, reporting to the Head of Cyber Security & Network.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Monitor and analyze security events and incidents, using SIEM and security tools, to identify potential threats and vulnerabilities. Work alongside SOC to improve detection.
* Investigate and respond to security incidents, mitigating risks before they escalate.
* Implement and maintain security controls and measures to protect the organization's information systems.
* Collaborate with other teams to develop and enforce security policies and procedures.
* Conduct regular security assessments and audits to ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.
* Stay up to date with the latest cybersecurity trends and technologies to continuously improve the organization's security posture.
* Lead and help organization with IAM implementation and requirements.
* Provide guidance and improve Access control management.


**Qualifications**
**About you**
 You are a proactive and analytical problem-solver with a strong passion for cybersecurity. In our fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment, you thrive on taking initiative and staying one step ahead of potential threats. You have a sharp eye for detail, a critical-thinking mindset, and the ability to assess complex security challenges with confidence.
   

  

**Key Qualifications**
* 5+ years of proven experience in IT security operations work.
* Strong knowledge of IT security, networks, and cybersecurity principles.
* Experience with incident response, threat detection, and risk mitigation.
* Problem-solving skills and a critical-thinking mindset to assess and counter cyber threats.
* Ability to communicate complex security issues to technical and non-technical teams.The position requires the ability to express complex ideas fluently and spontaneously, requiring a C1 (advanced) level of Swedish & English.


**Meriting**
* Experience working with Microsoft defender
* Experience working with SASE (SSE)
* Experience working with Azure
* Professional Certifications such as CISSP, ISSAP, or Azure certifications


 Here at Sobi we live by our core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership!
   

  

**Additional Information**
**How to apply**
 We have an ongoing selection process in this recruitment and ask you to send your application as soon as possible. Click apply and include your resume in English.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team
   

  

* Emphasis on work/life balance
* Collaborative and team-oriented environment
* Opportunities for professional growth
* Diversity and Inclusion
* Competitive compensation for your work
* Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


 Sobi is a global company with over 1,800 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. We are a specialised international biopharmaceutical company transforming the lives of people with rare and debilitating diseases, providing reliable access to innovative medicines in the areas of haematology, immunology, and specialty care. Sobi’s share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. More about Sobi at sobi.com and LinkedIn.
   

  

 We know our employees are our most valuable asset and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.
   

  

**Sobi Culture**
 At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.
   

  

 As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

title: Projektledare IT
description:
**Driv digital utveckling i Sundbybergs stad!**
 Är du en strategisk och lösningsorienterad person med djup förståelse för IT och upphandling? Vill du vara med och säkerställa att stadens digitala system och tjänster utvecklas och implementeras effektivt? Då är detta en möjlighet för dig!
   

  

**Här i Sundbybergs stad** 
 söker vi nu en teknisk projektledare som kommer att spela en central roll i att representera IT genom hela livscykeln för systemanskaffning – från behovsanalys och kravställning till implementering och överlämning till förvaltningsorganisationen. Rollen innebär också att ansvara för stadens tekniska kravkatalog kopplad till IT-system. Du blir en nyckelperson i vår digitala transformation och säkerställer att våra IT-lösningar möter både verksamhetens behov och tekniska krav.
   

  

**Som IT-projektledare** 
 ansvarar du för att driva och samordna IT-arbetet vid systemanskaffning och implementering av system. Du säkerställer att IT-krav beaktas genom hela processen, från tidiga analyser till färdig implementering och förvaltning. Du har även huvudansvaret för den IT-tekniska kravkatalogen där du strukturerar och uppdaterar de krav som staden ställer på verksamhetssystem.
   

  

 I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår att representera IT i hela systemanskaffningsprocessen och säkerställa att IT-krav tydligt definieras och efterlevs. Du ansvarar för att den IT-tekniska kravkatalogen kopplat till system och digitala tjänster utvecklas och förvaltas. Du leder och koordinerar arbetet ur ett tekniskt perspektiv i verksamheternas upphandlingar, från behovsanalys till implementering och drift. Ditt mål är att säkerställa att IT-lösningar uppfyller krav på säkerhet, integration och användbarhet. Kort sagt, samarbeta nära verksamhet, IT-enhet, upphandlare och leverantörer för att optimera stadens IT-lösningar.
   

  

**Vi vill att du** 
 har en akademisk examen inom IT, systemvetenskap eller annat relevant område, eller motsvarande erfarenhet. Du har flerårig erfarenhet av att leda IT-projekt inom offentlig sektor, kopplat till upphandling och kravställning. Du har även god förståelse för IT-upphandling och relevant lagstiftning (exempelvis LOU) och erfarenhet av att formulera och förvalta tekniska kravspecifikationer. Du har grundläggande kunskaper inom IT-säkerhet, integration och systemförvaltning. Du har förmåga och är van vid att kommunicera tekniska lösningar på ett pedagogiskt sätt till icke-tekniska målgrupper.
   

  

**I denna rekrytering** 
 lägger vi stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du vara analytisk, strukturerad och samarbetsinriktad. Du har en förmåga att skapa engagemang och samsyn mellan olika aktörer, samtidigt som du har ett skarpt öga för detaljer och säkerställer att IT-kraven efterlevs genom hela processen.
   

  

**Sundbybergs stad** 
 är en modern och framåtriktad arbetsplats där digitalisering och innovation är viktigt. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du har möjlighet att påverka och utveckla både IT och verksamheten i stort.
   

  

 Här finns möjlighet till distansarbete efter individuella överenskommelser, ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag, förmånscykel, semesterväxling till extra lediga dagar, medlemskap i Sundbybergs kommunanställdas Idrottsförening (SKIF), och rabatterat årskort på simhallen. Ett stenkast från stadshuset finns Ursviks motionsområde med löp- och skidspår samt MTB-spår. För den konstintresserade finns möjlighet att bli medlem i konstföreningen Bladoram. För dig som vill cykla finns också bra cykelvägar, cykelförråd, omklädnad och dusch. Sundbyberg stad har goda kommunikationsmöjligheter med närhet till tunnelbana, tvärbana, pendeltåg och bussar.
   

  

 I vårt ljusa och moderna stadshus arbetar vi aktivitetsbaserat för att främja samarbete, kreativitet och lärande.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Befattningen är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Vi använder oss av arbetsprov i rekryteringsprocessen. Provanställning kan komma att bli aktuellt.
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetande. Urvalstester och bakgrundskontroll kan förekomma.
   

  

 I din ansökan ska du ange medborgarskap. Om du inte är medborgare i Sverige, EU, EES eller Schweiz måste du kunna styrka att du har ett giltigt arbetstillstånd. En stor del av vår verksamhet klassas som samhällsviktig, och tjänsten kan komma att krigsplaceras inom ramen för Sundbybergs stads roll i totalförsvaret.
   

  

 En stor del av vår verksamhet klassas som samhällsviktig verksamhet.
   

  

 Tjänsten kan komma att krigsplaceras inom ramen för Sundbybergs stads roll i totalförsvaret.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan senast 15 april.
   

  

**Välkommen att bli en del av Sundbybergs stad och bidra till framtidens digitala utveckling!**
 Observera att vi redan valt rekryteringskanaler och undanber oss därför kontakt från annons- och rekryteringsföretag.

title: Information Technology Project Manager
description:
**IT Project Manager ERP SAP** 




 Ruukki Construction is a supplier of steel-based building products and services for roofs and walls for sustainable buildings. We employ around 1500 people and have 11 specialized manufacturing sites. Our strong presence in 10 European countries enables us to serve customers locally with our main brands Ruukki and Plannja. Our comparable net sales in 2021 were around EUR 590 million. We are of Nordic origin, part of SSAB, sharing values, and have long experience in steel and construction industry.
 



  





 Ruukki Construction IT is searching for a Project Manager to join the global IT team. You will be working as a Project Manager for selected high-profile projects within the IT area. The projects can be but are not limited to process development within ERP domain, ERP rollouts, digital sales channel development and other business application development projects. You will be working closely with our business stakeholders and IT community within Ruukki Construction and our mother company SSAB.
 



  





 In addition to managing projects, you will maintain and develop our project management methodology and coach other team members in their project management duties.
 



  





**You have following qualifications** 




 - Over 5 years of experience in managing complex IT projects in a multi-cultural environment
 



 - Good interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
 



 - You can work under pressure
 



 - You are result-oriented and structured
 



 - You possess experience in running projects in different modes (agile, hybrid, waterfall)
 



 - M. Sc or B.Sc. in a relevant field
 



 - Fluent English skills
 



 - Experience in running ERP projects is considered an advantage
 



  





**As a person, you:** 




 - are hands-on type of leader that can collaborate with both IT and business
 



 - are curious and eager to share own knowledge
 



 - are collaborative and a true team player
 



 - like to challenge and be challenged
 



 - can see the big picture but not forgetting important details
 



 - can work under pressure and manage deadlines
 



  





 We offer an opportunity to contribute Ruukki’s business and IT strategy execution and interesting global projects. On top you will get supportive and skilled colleagues and an inspiring atmosphere as well as opportunities for professional development and growth.
 



 We offer flexible working hours and an option to work remotely. Your home base may locate in the following Ruukki offices: Pärnu Estonia, all locations Finland, Zyrardow or Wroclaw in Poland, Göteborg or Stockholm in Sweden. Some travelling is required.
 



  





 We offer you an international work environment with challenging projects. Ruukki is a leading company in our industry and we are looking to shape the industry and ways of working. Ruukki is leading the way in sustainability and you can contribute to the development of more sustainable future. You will have the opportunity to work with us in modernizing our business application landscape as well as playing a key role in developing our project management competences further.
 



  





**How to apply:** 




 Our recruitment partner Barona IT will handle processing of applications and communication with candidates. Please leave your application no later than April 25th. Please be quick since the position will be filled as soon as a matching candidate has been identified. For more information, please contact our recruitment partners Agnes Hildén at agnes.hilden@barona.se.
 



  





 We cannot accept CVs via email, so please submit your application directly through Barona's recruitment system using the provided application link. Background check may be a part of the recruitment process.
 



  





**About Ruukki** 




 Ruukki Construction aims to lead the construction industry towards carbon neutrality with its products. Our 1,350 employees in 10 European countries and 13 specialized production facilities provide steel-based construction products and services for the roofs and walls of sustainable buildings. We serve our customers locally with our main brands Ruukki and Plannja. Our turnover in 2023 was approximately EUR 505 million. We are of Nordic origin and share our values and long experience in the steel and construction industries with our parent company SSAB.
 



  





*We decline contacts from recruitment agencies and ad sellers regarding this advertisement.*

title: Project Coordinator
job_function: Project Management, Administrative, and Customer Service
description:
**About the Role** 




 Reporting into the Consulting Support Manager, the Project Coordinator is part of the team responsible for the operational side of our consulting delivery to our clients. Working alongside our Consultants, the Consulting Support team project manage, coordinate and provide administration for our talent management services. The Project Coordinator supports the Consulting Support Project Lead as well as the Lead Consultant with the delivery process for more complex projects and manages small-scale projects themselves. This position requires collaboration with both internal and external stakeholders, including clients and participants. They may also contribute to sales and marketing activities, assist with event and office management, and liaise with Corporate departments for operational projects as needed. This is usually a full-time, permanent position working around a 5-day week, though actual days and circumstances may vary depending on regional requirements.
 



  





**Role Responsibilities** 




**Operational oversight** 



* Proactively provide regular updates to Consulting Support Manager of project progress, challenges and achievements, as well as regular project updates
* Work with the Lead Consultant / Project Lead to track project progress, identify and manage any risks and issues and ensure projects are delivered on time, to budget and to the client's satisfaction.



  





**Project set up and management** 



* The Project Coordinator takes responsibility for the projects assigned to them by the Consulting Support Manager. This could be taking responsibility for the coordination of internal and external projects assigned from end to end, or could be supporting specific tasks within a project.
* Using information from the Lead Consultant/Project Manager set up the project in OpenAir including Tasks and Planned Hours. Track project progress and ensure hours are being booked by all those working on the project.
* Be proactive in determining the coordination tasks that need to be completed as a project progresses, anticipating any challenges and working to avoid or overcome them.
* Deliver regular status updates to the Lead Consultant regarding project progress, as needed.



  





**Client/participant management and support** 



* Support the Lead Consultant and Client Partner in managing the client relationship, ensuring a gold standard service (Professional, responsive, timely, accurate)
* Handle day to day communication with the client on logistics, participant bookings, project progress etc. Support with coordination of delivery dates and timetables.
* Book participant sessions (assessments, coaching, feedback, group sessions etc.) and record all details on project documentation/trackers. Send out related communications including any preparation work.
* Liaise with TechOps where required for implementation and product administration. Where possible, complete product administration including set up and issuing of invitations, monitoring of responses and downloading of reports.
* Co-ordinate the delivery process, including supporting assessment centres/workshops/proctoring, ensuring the smooth running of all elements for both in-person and online delivery.
* Manage any post-delivery communications/ reports.



  





**Financial Management** 



* Support the Project Lead in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all relevant internal stakeholders, ensuring technical feasibility and all relevant costs are considered.
* Assist with the financial aspects of projects, including system management, revenue management and invoice preparation and tracking, ensuring accuracy and promptness.
* Correctly set up and record projects in Open Air, ensuring all users are added, client details, invoicing and revenue recognition are correctly detailed for project and revenue analysis. Where Open Air is used for invoicing ensure all revenue recognition and invoicing is completed.



  





**Resource Planning** 



* Work with the Project Lead / Lead Consultant to resource client work to ensure the efficient use of internal resources and associates.
* Book and confirm sessions with participants and consultants. Issue SOWs & POs for associates where used.
* Co-ordinate materials, flights and accommodation, as required.



  





**Quality Assurance** 



* Regionally, where required, keep up-to-date records and details of internal material; as well as knowledge management systems like OpenAir, Salesforce and SharePoint
* Review materials/documentation/reports to ensure accuracy, clarity and professionalism.
* Collect, compile, analyse and manage client data ensuring it's confidentiality, accuracy and security. Monitor the completion of Consultant produced reports, co-ordinating QA, proofing and issuing to the client/candidate/participant as per the requirements of the SLA.
* Participate in project reviews and always seek to identify and record opportunities to improve processes and become more efficient in project coordination and delivery.



  





**Working within a global team** 



* Work with Consulting Support team members to provide support to other client projects, as needed.
* This is likely to be within the same region but may include supporting global projects or those in other regions, as well as knowledge sharing and cross-training where possible. Your role may require you to undertake additional tasks in order to provide effective service to our internal and external clients.



  





**Knowledge, Skills and Experience Requirements** 



* Previous experience in a project management environment is preferred.
* Education/certification in project management is preferred.
* Proficiency in using web-based project management software, e.g. MS Project, Jira etc.
* Strong IT skills and the ability to learn new systems quickly.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office products, e.g. Outlook, Excel, Word, Teams etc.
* Previous experience in the talent management industry is desirable but not required.
* Demonstrable evidence of being able to collaborate effectively with others, multi-task, and prioritize workloads for self and others

title: Nätverkstekniker
description:
Har du erfarenhet inom nätverk och infrastruktur och är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär? Hos Amendo Tech får du möjligheten att arbeta med ledande företag inom bank, finans, retail, myndigheter, produktbolag och innovativa startups. Vi söker just nu engagerade konsulter för kommande interimsuppdrag som kan stärka våra kunders tekniska landskap och säkerställa deras infrastruktur och nätverk på högsta nivå.
   

  

 Din kompetens & profil
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är kunnig inom nätverksarkitektur och säkerhet och som har erfarenhet av att designa, implementera och övervaka nätverkslösningar i komplexa miljöer. Du har arbetat med några av följande tekniker:
   

  

* Nätverksprotokoll och teknik: Stark kompetens inom TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VLAN, VPN och routingprotokoll (t.ex. OSPF, BGP).
* Brandväggar och säkerhet: Erfarenhet av brandväggar, IDS/IPS, och andra säkerhetslösningar, exempelvis Cisco ASA, Palo Alto eller Fortinet.
* Trådlösa nätverk: Erfarenhet av att konfigurera och hantera trådlösa nätverk (WLAN) och Wi-Fi-lösningar.
* Lastbalansering och redundans: Kunskap om lastbalanserare och failover-lösningar för att säkerställa hög tillgänglighet.
* Nätverksövervakning och felsökning: Vana vid att använda övervakningsverktyg.
* Certifieringar: Gärna certifieringar inom Cisco (t.ex. CCNA, CCNP) eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Molnplattformar: Gedigen erfarenhet av AWS, Azure, eller Google Cloud Platform samt arbete med hybridmoln-arkitektur.
* Virtuella miljöer: Erfarenhet av virtualiseringsteknologier som VMware, Hyper-V eller KVM.
* Serveradministration: Kompetens inom Windows- och Linux-servrar, inklusive säkerhetspatchning och hantering av Active Directory.
* Lagring och backup: Kunskap om SAN, NAS och backuplösningar som Veeam eller Commvault.
* Automatisering och scripting: Förmåga att effektivisera och automatisera arbetsflöden med hjälp av PowerShell, Python eller Ansible.
* Säkerhet och övervakning: Förståelse för säkerhetspraxis och vana vid övervakningsverktyg för driftssäkerhet, exempelvis Zabbix eller Splunk.


 Du har en vilja, nyfikenhet och drivkraft att vilja skapa nytta hos kunden samt lära dig nytt. En problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta initiativ och vågar utforska nya vägar och arbetssätt. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya sammanhang och processer. Du får saker gjorda och ser kunskapsluckor som en möjlighet för personlig utveckling. Du är analytisk och har stor förståelse för vikten av service och kommunikation.
   

  

 Som konsult kommer du att ställas inför en rad olika utmaningar, både från ett socialt och pragmatiskt perspektiv. Därför tror vi att du är öppen och ödmjuk för både förändring och för olikheter. Du har ett agilt sätt att möta problem och kan se dem från olika vinklar.
   

  

 Om Amendo Tech
   

  

 Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.
   

  

 Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.
   

  

 Frågor och kontakt
   

  

 Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 #IT

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?** 




  





 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
 


* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than
 **420 million** 
 active users per month.
* Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth
 
 with
 
 high profitability.
* Listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.



  





**We at the Infrastructure team,** 
 work on a vision to empower our product-oriented teams with a complete self-service analytics platform to make data-driven decisions possible in Truecaller, guaranteeing the stability, velocity, and delivery of the mainstream events pipeline.
 



  





**As a Data Engineer** 
 , you will play an important role in the Data Platform team which is responsible for building and maintaining a scalable, robust, self-service analytics platform.
 



  





**What do we expect from you:** 



* 3+ years of experience in data engineering
* Experience working with orchestration tool (ex: Airflow)
* Experience working with a large data set
* Experience building complex ETL pipelines
* Experience working with cloud providers such as GCP, AWS, or Azure
* Strong programming skills in Spark with Scala and Python
* Experience working with CI/CD tools like Jenkins and Git
* Strong understanding of Software Engineering practices and principles
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
* Self-motivated and have a proven ability to take initiative to own the problems that come up and solve them



  





**What will you work on:** 



* Maintaining and improving the ingestion pipeline to reliably deliver billions of events daily in defined SLA
* Provide support for all teams in building and optimizing their complex pipelines
* Work closely with other teams to identify pain points and problems around the platform
* Develop new tools and frameworks to improve the data platform
* Facilitate company-wide to be data-driven
* Work in close collaboration with data scientists and data analysts to help support their work in production
* Work with vast projects such as building an ML platform and streaming use cases
* Setup best practices and processes around software and data development



  





**It would be great if you also have:** 



* Working with messaging systems like Kafka
* Knowledge in Kubernetes
* Hands-on experience with any streaming platform
* Experience managing data warehouse in BigQuery or Redshift



  





 Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/
 



  





 Sounds like your dream job?
 



  





 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
 



 This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
 



 We only accept applications in English.
 



  





**What we offer:** 




  




* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package:** 
 Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There is something for everyone!



  





**Come as you are:** 




 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

title: IT-supporttekniker
description:
**Din vardag:**
 Du kommer
 **omgående** 
 att bli anställd av Wise IT och påbörja ditt uppdrag som konsult i en roll som IT-supporttekniker (1st och 2nd line) hos en av våra kunder – ett globalt SaaS-bolag med fokus på molnlösningar och digital transformation. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta med avancerade IT-miljöer och moderna SaaS-applikationer, samt hjälpa användare i en internationell miljö.
   

  

 I uppdraget kommer du att:
   

  

* Hantera supportärenden inom 1st och 2nd line via Zendesk, för huvudkontor, kliniker och vår globala marknad – genom personliga möten, online och över telefon.
* Administrera och underhålla moderna SaaS-applikationer som Azure, Intune, Office 365, Jamf, Google Workspace och Slack.
* Felsöka och dokumentera problem på plats och på distans med både Mac- och Windows-datorer, mobila enheter, programvara och annan IT-relaterad teknik.
* Bidra till att identifiera systematiska problem och repetitiva uppgifter samt arbeta med automatisering och effektivisering tillsammans med andra team inom IT.
* Skriva och uppdatera dokumentation för interna och externa användare, inklusive guider och processer för att förbättra användarupplevelsen.
* Vara en viktig spelare i teamets utveckling genom att bidra med idéer och förslag för att förbättra och effektivisera supportprocessen.


**Vi söker dig som är:**
 Tillgänglig för ny anställning
 **omgående** 
 . Du är optimistisk, erbjuder högkvalitativ service, kan prioritera och arbeta självständigt, och du trivs med att vara en del av ett team. Dessutom har du följande erfarenheter och färdigheter:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av IT-support inom 1st och 2nd line och slutanvändarteknik i moderna IT-miljöer.
* Erfarenhet av att felsöka och stödja system som Office 365, Active Directory, Azure, Google, Jira, Okta.
* Vana att arbeta i både Mac- och Windows-miljöer.
* Kunskap om MDM-lösningar som JAMF och Intune.
* Erfarenhet av IT-säkerhet och compliance är meriterande.
* Flytande svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


*Notera! För att möta kundens behov söker vi dig som kan starta uppdraget
 **omgående** 
 .*
**Passar vi för dig?**
 På Wise IT fokuserar vi på att matcha rätt kompetens med rätt uppdrag och hjälper dig att växa i din karriär. Vi arbetar nära några av Sveriges mest framstående företag och organisationer, och som en del av vårt team får du möjlighet att arbeta i dynamiska och innovativa miljöer. Vi värdesätter din personliga utveckling och erbjuder uppdrag som utmanar dig och ger dig möjlighet att bidra med dina idéer och erfarenheter.
   

  

 Om du söker en arbetsplats med fokus på innovation, samarbete och personlig utveckling, då är vi rätt för dig. Ansök idag och bli en del av vårt team!

title: Nätverkstekniker till SAAB
description:
SAAB söker engagerade och drivna personer med ett passionerat intresse för nätverk. Som en viktig del av deras team kommer du att trivas i rollen som problemlösare och vara dedikerad till att leverera högkvalitativa och effektiva lösningar. Din förmåga att hjälpa andra och din vilja att ständigt fördjupa dina kunskaper inom nätverk kommer att vara avgörande.
   

  

 Till denna roll söker vi personer som har arbetat som nätverkstekniker i 4–8 år, samt personer med över 9 års erfarenhet som nätverkstekniker.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och möjlighet att samla värdefull erfarenhet i en spännande miljö där din utveckling prioriteras. Din konsultchef finns till hands för att stötta dig i din utveckling, vilket ger dig chansen att kontinuerligt bygga vidare på dina kunskaper och erfarenheter. En utmärkt möjlighet för dig som vill ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär!
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 I rollen som nätverkstekniker kommer du att vara en nyckelperson i teamet och ansvara för daglig drift, support och administration av nätverksinfrastrukturen. Ditt arbete kommer även inkludera hantering och felsökning av inkommande incidenter och beställningar.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta i en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du kommer få möjlighet att växa och utvecklas. Du kommer att ha utmanande och varierande arbetsuppgifter som ger dig möjlighet att ständigt utveckla dina färdigheter. Du kommer att vara en del av ett stöttande team och en företagskultur som värdesätter innovation och samarbete.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 Vi tror att du är en självgående och ansvarstagande individ som trivs i teamarbete. Du har en stark motivation att ständigt utvecklas och dela med dig av din kunskap till kollegor. Din förmåga att arbeta effektivt och leverera resultat av hög kvalitet kommer att vara nyckeln till framgång i denna roll.
   

  

**Krav**
* Relevant högskoleutbildning eller erfarenhet av liknande arbete.
* Minst fyra års erfarenhet av att ha arbetat som nätverkstekniker.
* Erfarenhet av Network Security och Network Operation.
* Erfarenhet av LAN baserat på Cisco, Dell, HPE Aruba
* Erfarenhet av CISCO ISE.
* Erfarenhet av Fortigate/Checkpoint.
* Kunskap inom något/några av följande områden: Cisco, Checkpoint, Fortinet, Citrix.
* Erfarenhet av scripting och automatisering.


 Uppdraget omfattas av försvarssekretess vilket sätter kvar på arbete på plats fem dagar i veckan. Säkerhetsprövningssamtal och bakgrundskontroll kommer att genomföras. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

 Mer om oss
   

  

 Centric är ett IT-företag med 370 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Principal Information Security Engineer-R-243026
company_industry: Financial Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Our Purpose**
*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*
****Title And Summary****
 Principal Information Security Engineer
   

  

**Overview**
 Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.
   

  

 Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.
   

  

 Mission First, People Always
   

  

 As Corporate Security, we are responsible for keeping Mastercard safe and secure from cyber and physical threats, and it is our people on the frontlines who make this happen every day.
   

  

 By taking care of our people, their wellbeing, and career development, we provide them the necessary tools and environment to ensure the success of our mission.
   

  

 Role
   

  

 The Business Security Enablement Guild Is Looking For a Principal Information Security Engineer To Join Our Team In Support Of Baffin Bay Networks. The Ideal Candidate Is Passionate About Cybersecurity Policies And Governance, Highly Motivated, Analytical, Experienced In Cybersecurity, And Knowledgeable In Cloud Service Deployment. In This Role, You Will:
   

  

* Provide cybersecurity expertise to help integrate a new Mastercard acquisition.
* Provide technical design and architecture advice to internal teams
* Proactively work to find solutions that align with business needs while operating within Mastercard’s risk tolerance that are scalable and can be applied across multiple programs and platforms.
* Cultivate and maintain working relationships with variety of internal stakeholders, including business owners, end-users, customers, project managers, engineers, and senior leadership
* Leverage security experience and knowledge within the security operations and technology
* Define security requirements and guidelines to ensure repeatable processes are followed by worldwide teams
* Assist in the strategy, standards, and architecture for the security aspects of the Security operation, architecture, and program health


**All About You**
 The ideal candidate for this position should have:
   

  

* Strong understanding of information security, risk and data privacy within the domain of digital commerce including relevant practical experience, integration of different security technologies, and designing secure multi-domain solutions
* Demonstrate a broad awareness of security operations concepts and practices across all phases of the delivery lifecycle
* Experience providing security architecture advice for web based network environments and secure communication, including mobile applications, web applications and web services
* Knowledge of relevant industry standards and guidelines such as ISO27001, PCI-DSS, NIST SP800-53, COBIT
* Knowledge and technical security experience in cryptography, including several of the following: encryption, hashing, key management, digital certificates, TLS
* Experience of continuous delivery/continuous integration processes and procedures including critical security considerations in automated workflows
* Strong knowledge of Security Operations and Integration in an enterprise environment


 NICE Framework References
   

  

 National Initiative for Cybersecurity Education (NICE) competency proficiency levels of advanced to expert in leadership operational, professional, and technical.
   

  

 This Mastercard role shares KSAs with related NICE work roles:
   

  

* SP-ARC-002, OPM652, Security Architect
* SP-TRD-001, OPM661, Research & Development Specialist
* SP-SRP-001, OPM641, Systems Requirements Planner
* SP-SYS-001, OPM631, Information Systems Security Developer
* OV-SPP-002, OPM751, Cyber Policy and Strategy Planner


 Corporate Security Responsibility
   

  

 Every Person Working For, Or On Behalf Of, Mastercard Is Responsible For Information Security. All Activities Involving Access To Mastercard Assets, Information, And Networks Comes With An Inherent Risk To The Organization And Therefore, It Is Expected That The Successful Candidate For This Position Must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.


**Corporate Security Responsibility**
 All Activities Involving Access To Mastercard Assets, Information, And Networks Comes With An Inherent Risk To The Organization And, Therefore, It Is Expected That Every Person Working For, Or On Behalf Of, Mastercard Is Responsible For Information Security And Must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

title: Business Process Re-engineering & Change Management Expert
description:

 is leading a consortium for the implementation of the EU funded project called:
 **Study of options to strengthen the Integrated Financial Management and Information System (IFMIS)** 
 and is searching for experts to support the core team during the implementation of this project.
 



 The
 **overall objective** 
 of this Assignment is to support the Government of The Gambia in its efforts to consolidate the security, reliability, efficiency, effectiveness and seamless integration of its public financial management systems.
 



  





**Location:** 
 Banjul, The Gambia.
 



  





**Duration:** 
 The indicative start date is
 **10 May 2025** 
 and the period of implementation of the specific contract will be 180 days from this date. Indicative end date:
 **6 November 2025** 
 .
 



  





**Business Process Re-engineering & Change Management Expert (Mid-Level)**




  





***☝️Qualifications and skills***
*:* 



* University degree in business administration, financial management, or IT with a focus on business processes.

***☝️Experience***

 If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply and upload your CV via LinkedIn or sent to recruitment@ntu.eu. Due to the large number of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Senior Liquidity Risk Controller | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Do you want to work strategically with the development of analysis and calculations of SEB’s liquidity risk metrics, MREL/TLAC and Resolution? Do you have knowledge and interest in bank balance sheet and have a passion for driving change as part of an agile team? We are now looking for a Senior Liquidity Risk Controller to join the Capital & Liquidity Reporting team at Group Finance, located in Arenastaden in Stockholm.
   

  

 Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success. We aim to drive positive change by providing capital to help everyone reach their goals and accelerate progress towards a sustainable tomorrow. As a leading financial services group in northern Europe, we'll help you grow and empower you to take on more responsibility to create a real difference. Welcome to SEB.
   

  

**About the role:**
 Group Finance aim to deliver reports, high quality data and analyzes for decision-making to our many stakeholders. You will have the opportunity to run your own initiatives and be part of the strategic work needed to achieve the Group Finance common goals. Above all, you will work with monitoring and implementation of new directives and regulations from the supervisory authorities/regulators and make information further available internally within the bank. The position also includes daily and monthly analysis, calculation and reporting of the bank's liquidity coverage ratio (LCR), net stable funding ratio (NSFR) as well as several other liquidity reports, such as ALMM, MREL, Resolution Reporting and Asset Encumbrance.
   

  

 In the Capital & Liquidity Reporting department, we have nine experts with a solid understanding of capital adequacy, balance sheet analysis and liquidity risk reporting. We work globally with our subsidiaries and interact closely with other departments of the bank such as Group Financial Management, Risk and IT. All work is done in close collaboration with our Global Services department in Vilnius, where the production of the metrics and IT development is located.
   

  

**Who are we looking for?**
 To succeed in your role with us you need to be independent, structured, reliable and driven person, with an interest and understanding of the financial market and commitment to deadlines. You have ability to build positive relationships and a willingness to drive the bank's development work forward with a long-term perspective taken into consideration. You can understand and solve complicated financial problems in a structured way and present them easily and comprehensibly.
   

  

**You also have:**
* A degree from college or university as an engineer or within finance
* Good understanding of banks and bank regulations, such as CRR, BCBS 239 and BRRD
* Good understanding of a banks balance sheet
* Advanced skills in Excel/MS Office
* SQL skills are not a requirement but considered as an advantage
* Tableau skills are not a requirement but considered as an advantage
* Strong communication skills in English
* Minimum 10 year of experience working with similar topics
* General understanding of working with Lean-Agile principles is considered as beneficial


**What we offer:**
* A dynamic work environment where you can drive continuous improvements
* Opportunities for continuous learning and professional development
* An environment among high performing and highly skilled colleagues
* Hybrid work model, exclusive SEB benefits and an attractive workplace


**Great people often know great people – please share if you have a friend who would love this job.**
**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than
 **30th April, 2025** 
 . If you have questions about the position, please contact Elma Efica Ereq, Acting Department Manager, on +46707676172 or by mail elma.efica.ereq@seb.se , but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Technical Account Manager, ISV North
description:
**Description**
 An AWS Technical Account Manager is a trusted advisor and cloud operations architect for our Enterprise Support customers. As a trusted advisor you’ll have a direct impact in helping our customers gain the most value from cloud technology. You’ll craft and execute strategies to drive our customers’ adoption and use of AWS services. You will provide advocacy and strategic technical guidance to help plan and build solutions using best practices, and proactively keep your customers’ AWS environments operationally healthy. The close relationships developed with your customers will allow you to understand their business/operational needs and technical challenges, and help them achieve the greatest value from AWS.
   

  

 Our Technical Account Managers partner with some of the most iconic businesses in the country. These range from rising startups building their business from scratch through to large enterprises going through significant transformation. You’ll provide advice on architecture, support strategy, project, and launch planning as well as ongoing operational issues.
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.
   

  

 The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* You’ll build solutions, provide technical guidance and advocate for the customer
* Ensure AWS environments remain operationally healthy whilst reducing cost and complexity
* Develop trusting relationships with customers, understanding their business needs and technical challenges
* Using your technical acumen and customer obsession, you’ll drive technical discussions regarding incidents, trade-offs, and risk management
* Consult with a range of partners from developers through to C-suite executives
* Collaborate with AWS Solutions Architects, Business Developers, Professional Services Consultants, and Sales Account Managers
* With a bias for action, you'll proactively find opportunities for customers to gain additional value from AWS
* Solve a variety of problems across different customers as they migrate their workloads to the cloud
* Uplift customer capabilities by running workshops and other enablement sessions.


 As we continue to rapidly expand in EMEA, you’ll have plenty of opportunities to develop your technical, consulting and leadership skills. You’ll work with talented cloud technologists whilst expanding your knowledge of AWS products. You’ll also have the chance to receive mentor-ship and gain AWS certifications.
   

  

 Do you want to be part of history and transform businesses through cloud computing adoption? We would love to hear from you.
   

  

**About The Team**
 About AWS
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience in a similar role as a Technical Account Manager, Consultant, Solutions Architect, Platform Engineer, Systems Engineer, Cloud Architect etc.
* Understand operational parameters and troubleshooting for 2 or more of the following: Compute, Storage, Networking, CDN, Databases, DevOps, Big Data and Analytics, Security, Applications Development
* Internal enterprise or external customer-facing experience with the ability to clearly articulate to small and large audiences
* Ability to juggle tasks and projects in a fast-paced environment
* Customer obsessed


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Professional experience with cloud offerings such as AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform etc.
* Programming or scripting skills with a combination of Java, Python Perl, Ruby, C#, and/or PHP a plus but not a requirement
* Previous experience as a Software Engineer, Developer, DevOps Engineer etc.
* Understanding of DevOps practices and tools including Continuous Integration / Deployment, Puppet, Docker, Kubernetes, Chef is a plus
